intro: Lepigonum anceps, commonly known as the scarlet sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Lepigonum anceps is often found in open habitats such as grasslands, scrublands, and along rocky outcrops.
